title: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org
description: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org on GitHub

items.content_html:
When performing a fulltext search in SilverStripe 4.0.0 the 'start' querystring parameter is never escaped safely. This exposes a possible SQL injection vulnerability.

The issue exists in 3.5 and 3.6 but is less vulnerable, as SearchForm sanitises these variables prior to passing to mysql.

References

  • https://github.com/silverstripe/silverstripe-framework/commit/099a5a3c2d99ed39bdd8815e1e2790bb9351770b
  • https://github.com/silverstripe/silverstripe-framework/commit/a8465900bdc77199176c953890ce7587045b1ea4
  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/silverstripe/framework/SS-2017-008-1.yaml
  • https://www.silverstripe.org/download/security-releases/ss-2017-008
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-xx4r-5265-48j6
items.title: [silverstripe/framework] silverstripe/framework SQL injection in full text search

items.title: [silverstripe/framework] silverstripe/framework SQL injection in full text search

items.content_html:
All user login attempts are logged in the database in the LoginAttempt table. However, this table contains information in plain text, and may possible contain sensitive information, such as user passwords mis-typed into the username field.

In order to address this a one-way hash is applied to the Email field before being stored.

References

  • https://github.com/silverstripe/silverstripe-framework/commit/3e2bcaa0b49277ff7f7004b265a7fa80d0b92e5c
  • https://github.com/silverstripe/silverstripe-framework/commit/c5d6eb816d4ac5e9fa3d8bc4bd82de95719eb22d
  • https://github.com/silverstripe/silverstripe-framework/commit/f1dd3d6f03eb1d94c29c495994a1da9176a758d9
  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/silverstripe/framework/SS-2017-009-1.yaml
  • https://www.silverstripe.org/download/security-releases/ss-2017-009
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-ph62-fv59-vf9h
items.title: [silverstripe/framework] silverstripe/framework users inadvertently passing sensitive data to LoginAttempt

items.title: [silverstripe/framework] silverstripe/framework users inadvertently passing sensitive data to LoginAttempt

items.content_html:
In the CSV export feature of the CMS it's possible for the output to contain macros and scripts, which if imported without sanitisation into software (including Microsoft Excel) may be executed.

In order to safeguard against this threat all potentially executable cell values exported from CSV will be prepended with a literal tab character.

References

  • https://github.com/silverstripe/silverstripe-framework/commit/55739fa5af6171594b2cb4f3621d5fcce5e887d4
  • https://github.com/silverstripe/silverstripe-framework/commit/cfe1d4f481bf53ea8da2b8608a563e207d923df9
  • https://github.com/silverstripe/silverstripe-framework/commit/dd4c5417e7592e29e698af428b72bdb9b6729797
  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/silverstripe/framework/SS-2017-007-1.yaml
  • https://www.silverstripe.org/download/security-releases/ss-2017-007
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-mqjc-x563-c9q8
items.title: [silverstripe/framework] silverstripe/framework CSV Excel Macro Injection

items.content_html:
In the CSV export feature of the CMS it's possible for the output to contain macros and scripts, which if imported without sanitisation into software (including Microsoft Excel) may be executed.

In order to safeguard against this threat all potentially executable cell values exported from CSV will be prepended with a literal tab character.

items.content_html:
User enumeration is possible by performing a timing attack on the login or password reset pages with user credentials.

References

  • https://github.com/silverstripe/silverstripe-framework/commit/f0262a8fd9ab5fb51b178ace3c3487351217f5a0
  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/silverstripe/framework/SS-2017-005-1.yaml
  • https://www.silverstripe.org/download/security-releases/ss-2017-005
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-7m2v-x7rg-5hm5
items.title: [silverstripe/framework] silverstripe/framework vulnerable to user enumeration via timing attack on login and password reset forms

items.content_html:
User enumeration is possible by performing a timing attack on the login or password reset pages with user credentials.

References

  • https://github.com/silverstripe/silverstripe-framework/commit/f0262a8fd9ab5fb51b178ace3c3487351217f5a0
  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/silverstripe/framework/SS-2017-005-1.yaml
  • https://www.silverstripe.org/download/security-releases/ss-2017-005
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-7m2v-x7rg-5hm5
items.title: [silverstripe/framework] silverstripe/framework vulnerable to user enumeration via timing attack on login and password reset forms

items.content_html:
A security protection device in Session designed to protect session hijacking was not correctly functioning. This function intended to protect user sessions by detecting changes in the User-Agent header, but modifications to this header were not correctly invalidating the user session.

References

  • https://github.com/silverstripe/silverstripe-framework/commit/44de03da0147e6094b02602b7b73d5b1a1306d78
  • https://github.com/silverstripe/silverstripe-framework/commit/d47667bb0768841e4b305fa95d5a4e2ba232c4ad
  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/silverstripe/framework/SS-2017-006-1.yaml
  • https://www.silverstripe.org/download/security-releases/ss-2017-006
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-4qx8-j9vh-2628
items.title: [silverstripe/framework] silverstripe/framework's User-Agent header not correctly invalidating user session

items.content_html:
A security protection device in Session designed to protect session hijacking was not correctly functioning. This function intended to protect user sessions by detecting changes in the User-Agent header, but modifications to this header were not correctly invalidating the user session.

References

  • https://github.com/silverstripe/silverstripe-framework/commit/44de03da0147e6094b02602b7b73d5b1a1306d78
  • https://github.com/silverstripe/silverstripe-framework/commit/d47667bb0768841e4b305fa95d5a4e2ba232c4ad
  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/silverstripe/framework/SS-2017-006-1.yaml
  • https://www.silverstripe.org/download/security-releases/ss-2017-006
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-4qx8-j9vh-2628
items.title: [silverstripe/framework] silverstripe/framework's User-Agent header not correctly invalidating user session

items.content_html:
Authenticated user with page edit permission can craft HTML, which when rendered in a page history comparison can execute client scripts.

References

  • https://github.com/silverstripe/silverstripe-framework/commit/2b72c0f73b668ddf7c059319da915a6c08652278
  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/silverstripe/framework/SS-2017-004-1.yaml
  • https://www.silverstripe.org/download/security-releases/ss-2017-004
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-c4c3-j73v-634r
items.title: [silverstripe/framework] silverstripe/framework has Cross-site Scripting vulnerability in page history comparison

items.content_html:
Authenticated user with page edit permission can craft HTML, which when rendered in a page history comparison can execute client scripts.

References

  • https://github.com/silverstripe/silverstripe-framework/commit/2b72c0f73b668ddf7c059319da915a6c08652278
  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/silverstripe/framework/SS-2017-004-1.yaml
  • https://www.silverstripe.org/download/security-releases/ss-2017-004
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-c4c3-j73v-634r
items.title: [silverstripe/framework] silverstripe/framework has Cross-site Scripting vulnerability in page history comparison

items.content_html:
RedirectorPage will allow users to specify a non-url malicious script as the redirection path without validation. Users which follow this url may allow this script to execute within their browser.

References

  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/silverstripe/framework/SS-2017-003-1.yaml
  • https://www.silverstripe.org/download/security-releases/ss-2017-003
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-pp7q-6j3f-74vj
items.title: [silverstripe/framework] silverstripe/framework has Cross-site Scripting vulnerability in RedirectorPage

items.content_html:
RedirectorPage will allow users to specify a non-url malicious script as the redirection path without validation. Users which follow this url may allow this script to execute within their browser.

References

  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/silverstripe/framework/SS-2017-003-1.yaml
  • https://www.silverstripe.org/download/security-releases/ss-2017-003
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-pp7q-6j3f-74vj
items.title: [silverstripe/framework] silverstripe/framework has Cross-site Scripting vulnerability in RedirectorPage

items.content_html:
In follow up to SS-2016-001 there is yet a minor unresolved fix to incorrectly encoded URL.

References

  • https://github.com/silverstripe/silverstripe-framework/commit/6b123fe1c93d3ac976f484192abc31cad4f81d47
  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/silverstripe/framework/SS-2016-016-1.yaml

  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-r85g-7jpv-8xrx
items.title: [silverstripe/framework] silverstripe/framework has Cross-site Scripting vulnerability in CMSSecurity BackURL
